description: This course introduces differential equations and analytical, numerical, and graphical techniques
for the analysis of their solutions.  First- and second-order differential equations and linear
systems are studied.  Applications are selected from areas such as biology, chemistry, economics,
ecology, and physics.  Laplace transforms or nonlinear systems may be covered as time permits.
Students  use computers extensively to calculate and visualize results.  Prerequisite: MATH
126 or MATH 128 and MATH 220. Offered each semester. Counts toward neuroscience and
